text: [Music]
[Music]
hello i'm nandhi a cloud operations
engineer here at the aws office in
sydney
today i'm going to show you how you can
access trend microwave security manager
console using a read-only user
and then how to generate reports let's
get started to access the trend micro
dsm console you must have a read-only
user account to request a read-only user
account submit an rfc and provide ams
support with the private ips network
range this source network that you will
access the dsm console from when using
today connect or vpn
note access to dsm console is provided
only over data connect or vpn not over
public internet
to submit the request for a read-only
user account rfc follow these steps
after logging to the aws console
navigate to the aws managed services
console
on the left hand side select request for
change rfc and then select create roc
on the create rfc page choose change
type page and then choose
select the category to open a series or
drop down list
choose category management
subcategory other
item other
and operation
create after you select the correct
change type choose next to proceed to
step 2 of the process to create the rfc
enter the subject description and
comment fields as needed
select the priority of the rfc and then
choose create
after english support receives the rfc
we will create the read-only user
account for you we will share the
password using aws secret manager along
with the dsm console url with you
for this video we have already created a
user and will be using this user for the
next section of the video
let's see how we can access the password
from aws secret manager
after logging into the aws management
console navigate to the secrets manager
console
from the list of secrets identify the
secret shared by ams for example ams
shared train micro read only user
credentials and choose it
in the secret value section choose
retrieve secret value
choose the secret key and value to see
the credentials that are parsed out as
individual keys and values
when you have done this let us know we
will remove the secret from secrets
manager
now let's access the dsm console
the dsf console is accessible through
the customer bastion server
go to the dsm access url https colon
double backslash dsm.sentinel.int
from the customer bastion server and
login using the credentials that you
received from aws secrets manager
when you log into the console for the
first time you will be asked to change
the password change the password and
then you can access the console
i have already changed the password for
my user account and using the same to
login to the console
finally let's check how to generate the
report for auditing purpose first go to
the events and reports tab
then
choose generate reports on the bottom
left corner from here select the single
report tab fill out the form by
selecting the report type classification
level and format depending on the report
you might need to specify a date and
time range alert reports require this
when you are done selecting all the
required fields and filters choose the
generate button on the right bottom
corner the report will be downloaded to
your local computer
now you know how to request a read only
user account to access trend microtip
security manager console and generate
reports when required
thanks for watching and happy cloud
computing from all of us here at aws
[Music]
